articles.headline: Backpack Makers Rethink a Student Staple
articles.snippet: As the need to carry textbooks becomes less important, the backpack is being redesigned for electronics and the everyday needs of living on the go.
articles.abstract: As the need to carry textbooks becomes less important, the backpack is being redesigned for electronics and the everyday needs of living on the go.
articles.lead_paragraph: The inside of Alejandro Sarete’s backpack is jammed with the objects of a busy student life: smartphone, USB thumb drive, playing cards, lip balm. Cho Young-Uk’s shoulder bag is more minimalist in content: Lenovo laptop and adapter.

articles.headline: Some Hedge Funds Prosper in Market Tumult
articles.snippet: The former disciples of Steven A. Cohen seem to have done exceptionally well, thriving in an environment that has jolted others.
articles.abstract: The former disciples of Steven A. Cohen seem to have done exceptionally well, thriving in an environment that has jolted others.
articles.lead_paragraph: A market sell-off that ricocheted across the globe last month reversed the fortunes of many of Wall Street’s star investors. But it is not all doom and gloom in the $3 trillion hedge fund industry.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Low-Income Workers See Biggest Drop in Paychecks
articles.snippet: Despite an improving economy, the take-home pay for many Americans has fallen since 2009, and the sharpest decline has been experienced by those with the lowest-paid jobs.
articles.abstract: Despite an improving economy, the take-home pay for many Americans has fallen since 2009, and the sharpest decline has been experienced by those with the lowest-paid jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Despite steady gains in hiring, a falling unemployment rate and other signs of an improving economy, take-home pay for many American workers has effectively fallen since the economic recovery began in 2009, according to a new study by an advocacy group that is to be released on Thursday.

articles.headline: Migrant Chaos Mounts While Divided Europe Stumbles for Response
articles.snippet: The struggle to develop a coherent response intensified as new calls for a blocwide plan were met with recriminations about the Continent being swamped with Muslims.
articles.abstract: The struggle to develop a coherent response intensified as new calls for a blocwide plan were met with recriminations about the Continent being swamped with Muslims.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The struggle among European leaders to develop a coherent response to the spiraling migrant crisis intensified on Thursday as fresh calls for a blocwide plan were met with recriminations about the Continent being swamped with Muslims.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Dan Bilefsky

articles.headline: Otto Pérez Molina of Guatemala Is Jailed Hours After Resigning Presidency
articles.snippet: The decision to detain Mr. Pérez Molina is unprecedented in Guatemalan history and was a stunning conclusion to a day of swift change in the nation.
articles.abstract: The decision to detain Mr. Pérez Molina is unprecedented in Guatemalan history and was a stunning conclusion to a day of swift change in the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUATEMALA CITY — Just hours after tendering his resignation as president of Guatemala, Otto Pérez Molina was sent to jail to await the conclusion of a hearing examining his role in a multimillion-dollar customs fraud case that has shaken the nation and sent reverberations throughout the region.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Elisabeth Malkin

articles.headline: Chinese Rail Firm Makes Inroads with U.S. Factory and Boston Transit Deal
articles.snippet: China Rolling Rail Stock Corporation is building a plant in Springfield, Mass., and under a $566 million contract will assemble 284 Boston subway cars.
articles.abstract: China Rolling Rail Stock Corporation is building a plant in Springfield, Mass., and under a $566 million contract will assemble 284 Boston subway cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s biggest rail manufacturing company is setting its sights on the United States. It broke ground on Thursday for a $60 million plant in Springfield, Mass., that will assemble new cars for Boston’s subway system.

articles.headline: Image of Drowned Syrian, Aylan Kurdi, 3, Brings Migrant Crisis Into Focus
articles.snippet: The case of a young boy’s doomed journey has landed as a political bombshell across the Middle East and Europe.
articles.abstract: The case of a young boy’s doomed journey has landed as a political bombshell across the Middle East and Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — The smugglers had promised Abdullah Kurdi a motorboat for the trip from Turkey to Greece, a step on the way to a new life in Canada. Instead, they showed up with a 15-foot rubber raft that flipped in high waves, dumping Mr. Kurdi, his wife and their two small sons into the sea.
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard and Karam Shoumali
